translations.translation: You will jump over the log.
I won't/cant jump it.
That one is high.
OK, I will jump this.
OK , I will/can jump that one.
That man is laughing.
Why (is he) laughing?
That man is always laughing.
That man scratches his shin.
Don't scratch.
OK, I won't scratch.
What's your name?
My name is Dhabili.

notes: example - response to basic question (What is your name?)

translations.translation: I forgot his name.
Who is that man? (What is that man called, e.g. accusative in S13 this document.)
This boomerang is broken.
Throw this one away.
OK, I throw away this message stick.
(They) will talk, have a meeting.
They are sending us a message stick.
I think we will look for your boomerang.
I will look for his boomerang.

sentences.transcription: wankinga barninyi nganyi wankinga nhungka bakarranyianga

translations.translation: I looked, I couldn't find his boomerang.
That group of women are having a fight.
The day before yesterday the women all fought.
Tomorrow the women will all fight (together).

sentences.transcription: wiyiani nhaniguru marrigala/ dhupuanha ngathu wupigala

translations.translation: This fire is burning. I smell smoke.
The woman is scolding this child.
Cover up this kangaroo with ashes.
OK, I will cover this meat.
Uncover that meat.
OK, I will uncover it.
That man is telling a lie.
You made that boomerang.
I haven't made it yet.
I won't turn around.
Put (it) on the ground over there.
OK, I put (it) over there on the ground.
Hold this stick.
OK, I will hold (it) for you.

sentences.transcription: dumpa nganha nhanhaguru bakarranyinha/ ngathu nadyarra

translations.translation: Show me that boomerang, I want to see it.

sentences.transcription: walya ngathu inha dumparra/ walya gadha ngathu mulpagala

translations.translation: I will not show you, I haven't finished (it) yet.
I think the two of us will hide over there.
Here look out quick for kangaroos.
Hide there.

sentences.transcription: makurra nhaniguru buligaliani gurrgalanga wirlidhirra bari ngalingu

translations.translation: A stick fell in the road. (A stick has fallen on the road.) The two of us will drag it away I think.
Look out one might fall on you.
The tree fell on me.

sentences.transcription: makurrani nhaniyi garlgugarlgunhani/ guntutyirri nhani bari bulirra

translations.translation: This stick is rotten. I think it will fall soon. (This stick is rotten so I think it will fall.)
This snake is moving.
Look out, it might bite you.
(It?) hasn't gone away, I think.

sentences.transcription: gari walya yanhtha/ nadyarra ngathu inha

translations.translation: Hey don't go away, I want to see you.

sentences.transcription: gari bura nhanhaguru nadyarra ngathu nhanha

translations.translation: Hey, tell that one I want to see him.
Hey you two.
Hey you all.

sentences.transcription: gala bula bura nadyarra ngathu nhanha

translations.translation: Hey you two, tell (him) I want to see him.

sentences.transcription: murra ngathu buranga nhanha/ gulharra nhani/ yundru nadyarra nhanha

translations.translation: OK, I told him, he will wait, you will see him.
Follow me.
You will follow me. (Repeated twice in original corpus.)
Hunt that kangaroo.

sentences.transcription: walya ngathu nhanhaguru gangalangu/ gumiani nhaniguru

translations.translation: I cannot carry this. It is big.

sentences.transcription: ga ngathu inha walibarra/ ngalingu barrkululu ganggarra nhanhaguru

translations.translation: Yes I will help you. The two of us will carry this one.
OK I met your father.
